headline: Friday's big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
summary: The Dow Industrials lost more than 260 points on Thursday as fears over private credit and simmering tensions between the U.S. and Iran weighed on the market.

headline: 5 Dividend-Paying Giants Have Been on Goldman Sachs Conviction List the Longest
summary: Goldman Sachs is the acknowledged leader in the investment landscape on Wall Street and worldwide. The firm’s top-notch research department continues to provide institutional and high-net-worth clients with the best ideas across the investment spectrum and is likely to do so for years to come. Founded in 1869, Goldman Sachs is the world’s second-largest investment ... 5 Dividend-Paying Giants Have Been on Goldman Sachs Conviction List the Longest

headline: Is Huntington Ingalls (HII) Quietly Redefining Its Efficiency Story With AI-Driven Shipyard Automation?
summary: In February 2026, Path Robotics announced it had signed a memorandum of understanding with Huntington Ingalls Industries to explore integrating Path’s physical AI welding systems into HII’s shipbuilding operations, focusing on autonomous shipbuilding capabilities, workforce training, and an intellectual property framework for AI-based welding. The collaboration highlights how AI-driven welding that adapts to complex, real-world shipyard conditions could help HII boost throughput while...
